learningContent.title: Adding a properties table to a reference

lcInstruction.p: The <properties> element is used to present a series of properties pertaining to the current topic. It contains an optional <prophead> element, and then one or more <property elements.

step.cmd: After the <refsyn> element, add a <properties> element and populate it with a <prophead> element.

stepxmp.pre:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE task PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA Reference//EN" "reference.dtd"> <reference id="my_first_ref"> <title>Navigating the Duck Database</title> <refbody> ... </refsyn> <properties> <prophead>
</prophead> </properties> </refbody> </reference>

step.cmd: Inside the <prophead> element, add a <proptypehd>, <propvaluehd>, and <propdeschd> element and add content to it as shown.

stepxmp.pre: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE task PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA Reference//EN" "reference.dtd"> <reference id="my_first_ref"> <title>Navigating the Duck Database</title> <refbody> ... </refsyn> <properties> <prophead> <proptypehd>Type</proptypehd> <propvaluehd>Name</propvaluehd> <propdeschd>Description</propdeschd> </prophead> </properties> </refbody> </reference>

info.p: While not all required, the elements added here must be in this specific order. If they are not, your document will not validate.

step.cmd: After the <prophead> element, add six <property> elements.

stepxmp.pre: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE task PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA Reference//EN" "reference.dtd"> <reference id="my_first_ref"> <title>Navigating the Duck Database</title> <refbody> ... </refsyn> <properties> <prophead> <proptypehd>Type</proptypehd> <propvaluehd>Name</propvaluehd> <propdeschd>Description</propdeschd> </prophead> <property></property> <property></property> <property></property> <property></property> <property></property> <property></property> </properties> </refbody> </reference>

step.cmd: Inside each <property> element, add a <proptype>, <propvalue>, and <propdesc> element and add content to it as shown.

stepxmp.pre: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE task PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA Reference//EN" "reference.dtd"> <reference id="my_first_ref"> <title>Navigating the Duck Database</title> <refbody> ... </refsyn> <properties> <prophead> <proptypehd>Type</proptypehd> <propvaluehd>Name</propvaluehd> <propdeschd>Description</propdeschd> </prophead> <property> <proptype>Table</proptype> <propvalue>dbo.DABBL</propvalue> <propdesc>Dabbling ducks</propdesc> </property> <property> <proptype>Table</proptype> <propvalue>dbo.DVNG</propvalue> <propdesc>Diving ducks</propdesc> </property> <property> <proptype>Table</proptype> <propvalue>dbo.WHST</propvalue> <propdesc>Whistling ducks</propdesc> </property> <property> <proptype>View</proptype> <propvalue>regn.ne</propvalue> <propdesc>Ducks located primarily in the northeast</propdesc> </property> <property> <proptype>View</proptype> <propvalue>regn.se</propvalue> <propdesc>Ducks located primarily in the southeast</propdesc> </property> <property> <proptype>View</proptype> <propvalue>pttrn.migr</propvalue> <propdesc>Ducks organized by migratory pattern</propdesc> </property> </properties> </refbody> </reference>
